definition: To pass by or go past something or someone, typically used to describe the action of walking or moving past a particular object, location, or person. It often implies a casual or nonchalant passing, without stopping or giving much attention.

examples.german: Er geht an mir vorbei, ohne mich zu grüßen.
examples.english: He walks past me without greeting me.

examples.german: Wir müssen an der Bushaltestelle vorbeigehen, um zur Schule zu gelangen.
examples.english: We have to walk past the bus stop to get to school.

examples.german: Sie geht jeden Tag an diesem Café vorbei.
examples.english: She passes by this café every day.

examples.german: Der Zug fährt am Bahnhof vorbei, ohne anzuhalten.
examples.english: The train passes by the station without stopping.
